AttackerCapabilities: Knowledge of insecure/public AWS S3 buckets
Familiarity with command line and basic scripting

SecurityMeasures: No authentication or access control on the S3 bucket

Steps.Description: The attacker clones the S3Scanner tool from GitHub and installs its dependencies.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker believes that the target may have an insecure/public AWS S3 bucket.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker uses the S3Scanner tool to scan the target URL and dump its content.
StepDetails.Result: The S3Scanner tool successfully scans the target URL and dumps the content of the S3 bucket.

Steps.Description: The attacker navigates to the dumped content of the S3 bucket.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker assumes that the dumped content contains the flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker navigates to the dumped content of the S3 bucket.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker finds a text file named 'youfoundme-asd897kjm.txt' containing the flag.
